data.title: Higher Colleges of Technology
data.meta_description: Founded in 1988, the Higher Colleges of Technology HCT is the UAE’s largest applied higher educational institution, and the nation’s first approved university economic free zone, empowering it to graduate companies in alignment with the directives of the UAE’s wise leadership.
data.text:
About HCT

Founded in 1988, the Higher Colleges of Technology (HCT) is the UAE’s largest applied higher educational institution, and the nation’s first approved university economic free zone, empowering it to graduate companies in alignment with the directives of the UAE’s wise leadership..

Explore More

Programs

In line with international criteria, the UAE vision and future development requirements, HCT offers approximately 34 programs and 20 concentrations in the academic programs

Explore More

Admissions

The Higher Colleges of Technology offers a wide variety of programmes, covering its core academic Divisions, which are designed to meet the growing needs of the UAE. Prospective students can find detailed information in this section.

Explore More

E-services

HCT is always keen to enhance the customer experience and facilitate the student service journey

Explore More

Engage

e-participation is the participation and contribution by stakeholders and the public in the decision-making process of the Higher Colleges of Technology (HCT)

Explore More

Library

Higher Colleges of Technology (HCT) Libraries are among the best equipped in the Gulf region, housing extensive collections of resources.

Explore More

Open data

The Higher Colleges of Technology (HCT) Fact Book is published electronically on an annual basis by the HCT’s Organizational Excellence Department. The Fact Book provides current and historical information regarding academic programmes, enrollments, graduates and staff.

Explore More
